events.description: Joint Intelligence Objectives Agency established to recruit former Nazi scientists, laying groundwork for behavioral control programs
events.significance: Origin point of US mind control research programs

events.description: Harry Truman-era mind control program examining drugs and hypnosis for interrogation
events.significance: First official CIA behavioral control program

events.event: Project Bluebird renamed to Project Artichoke
events.description: Expanded program to determine if subjects could be involuntarily made to perform assassinations. Operated by CIA Office of Scientific Intelligence
events.significance: Escalation to assassination research and forced addiction experiments

events.description: CIA Director Allen Dulles formally approves MK-Ultra to develop mind-controlling drugs for use against Soviet bloc
events.significance: Official start of largest CIA mind control program

events.event: Sidney Gottlieb purchases world's LSD supply
events.description: Gottlieb arranged for CIA to pay $240,000 to buy entire world supply of LSD
events.significance: Demonstrates scale and priority of drug experimentation program

events.description: At Deep Creek Lake cabin meeting, Sidney Gottlieb covertly dosed Frank Olson and other CIA scientists with LSD in after-dinner liqueur
events.significance: Demonstrates unwitting dosing of even CIA's own personnel

events.description: Frank Olson plunged to death from hotel window in New York, 9 days after being dosed with LSD. Government ruled suicide/misadventure, evidence suggests murder
events.significance: First documented fatality linked to MK-Ultra; government coverup began immediately
events.concealment_action: Death ruled suicide to conceal CIA involvement

events.significance: Name change possibly to distance from growing concerns

events.description: Program terminated after 20 years of operation
events.significance: End of official program (potential continuation unknown)

events.description: CIA Director Richard Helms and Sidney Gottlieb destroy most MK-Ultra records upon program termination and Gottlieb's departure from CIA
events.significance: Active concealment - deliberate destruction of evidence of illegal human experimentation

events.description: Congressional Church Committee and Presidential Rockefeller Commission revealed CIA and DoD experiments on unwitting and cognizant human subjects
events.significance: First public acknowledgment of illegal programs
events.concealment_failure: Investigations forced partial disclosure despite destruction

events.description: Admiral Stansfield Turner revealed CIA found ~20,000 pages of MK-Ultra records at non-standard records center that survived 1973 destruction orders
events.significance: Partial evidence recovery - destruction was incomplete

timeline_analysis.critical_concealment_moment: 1973 record destruction - attempted to prevent accountability

pattern_identification.escalation_pattern: Drugs/hypnosis → Forced addiction/assassination → Mass LSD experimentation → Continuation under new name
pattern_identification.concealment_pattern: Immediate coverup (Olson 1953) → Systematic destruction (1973) → Forced disclosure (1975) → Partial evidence recovery (1977)
